definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: A Christmas tree was placed in the comer of the brilliant hall. How beautiful it was!
sentences.chinese: 圣诞树放在灯火通明的客厅的一角，实在是太荚了。

sentences.english: These rooms would be lighted up every evening.
sentences.chinese: 客房里的房间通宵达旦灯火通明。

sentences.english: It is winter and Dhaka is full of lights.
sentences.chinese: 隆冬时节的达卡灯火通明。

sentences.english: Who have already dared to say lights bright, person head does the move and then know nothing about solitude?
sentences.chinese: 谁有敢说灯火通明，人头攒动就不会孤独？

sentences.english: Lights burned on the building’s top floor.
Out on the deck, the ship's lights were on, and the moon was shining.
sentences.chinese: 跑到甲板上，大船灯火通明，月亮闪着银光。

sentences.english: Port Philip shimmered brightly, with every light in town turned on .
sentences.chinese: 菲利普港灯火通明，城里每盏灯都亮了。

sentences.english: Brightly-lit, noisy restaurants are packed day and night.
sentences.chinese: 灯火通明，嘈杂的饭馆日日夜夜地挤满了人。

sentences.english: Across the Hudson and the East Rivers are the Manhattan bridges with their strings of lights.
sentences.chinese: 横跨哈得孙河和伊斯特河的曼哈顿桥梁上灯火通明。

sentences.english: The normally glittering Bird's Nest stadium in Beijing looked distinctly grey.
sentences.chinese: 平时灯火通明的北京鸟巢体育场也显得有些灰暗。

sentences.english: Yesterday 22, the State Oceanic Administration, the East China Sea Forecast Center is still brightly lit.
sentences.chinese: 昨日22时，国家海洋局东海预报中心仍然灯火通明。

sentences.english: The main districts of Shanghai will be floodlit all through the night during National Holidays.
sentences.chinese: 国庆期间上海的主要区域将整夜灯火通明。

sentences.english: She remarked brightly, but I was aware of the falseness in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 她说灯火通明，但我知道在她的声音虚假。

sentences.english: The square was brilliantly illuminated throughout the night.
The lights were all on, staff in position.
sentences.chinese: 站内灯火通明，工作人员各就其位。

definition: lit. a boiling cauldron of voices (idiom)/hubbub/brouhaha
early evening when lanterns are first lit
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
to be decorated with lanterns and colored banners (idiom)
night scene/the dim light of night
